meanings.definition: Having the power to attract objects made of iron or steel.
meanings.sent1: The magnetic force pulled the metal paperclips towards it.
meanings.sent2: The refrigerator door had a magnetic strip to hold up notes.
meanings.sent3: The magnetic personality of the teacher made the students eager to learn.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so magnetic, it drew people to her like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic pull of the north pole on compass needles is fascinating.

meanings.definition: Capable of being attracted by or acquiring the properties of a magnet.
meanings.sent1: The magnetic material stuck to the fridge easily.
meanings.sent2: The toy car had a magnetic base to attach to metal surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The magnetic bracelet seemed to attract good luck wherever she went.
meanings.sent4: His words were so magnetic, they drew everyone's attention instantly.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic field around the magnet was invisible but powerful.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to exert a strong influence or charm.
meanings.sent1: The magnetic leader inspired his team to achieve great things.
meanings.sent2: The singer had a magnetic presence on stage that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magnetic effect of her perfume made everyone want to be near her.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were so magnetic that they attracted supporters from all over.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic pull of his charisma was undeniable in any room he entered.
